intro: Logania crassifolia var. minor, commonly known as the small-leaved logania, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related genera. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and showy, tubular flowers that typically range in color from pink to red. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
